cleaned_text: A month dedicated to Natural Therapies and Integrative Medicine! Over the course of a month, I had the great pleasure and joy of participating in a series of prestigious scientific events dedicated to promoting the values of natural therapies, which are the basis of Integrative Medicine. Thus, during June 23-25, the first Congress of the Romanian Society of Apitherapy, Phytotherapy and Aromatherapy took place in Bucharest, where at the invitation of [Dr.Stefan Stangaciu](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-stefan-stangaciu-7133a129?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAAXuKL8BVegXXW66qxjbHtCil8BbxbuZBJA&lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_search_srp_all%3BHXrQqQW6TD%2BGKJ4x39FC4g%3D%3D), the president of the society, I presented the paper "Natural Therapies in prevention and Treatment of type 2 diabetes". The Society of Integrative Medicine from Hungary organized a Summer University in Budapest, during July, 8-9, where at the invitation of [Dr. Karacsony Ferenc](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ferenc-dr-karacsony-20164384?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_profile_view_base_contact_details%3B5tOsG%2BRlS8qDjz7mMa901A%3D%3D), specialist in integrative medicine, I was present with two scientific works in which I tried to demonstrate the connection between phytotherapy and aromatherapy with energy meridians, specific to Traditional Chinese Medicine. Then followed the 9th Global Traditional and Integrative Medicine Webinar, in the period 13-15 July, an exceptional scientific event, organized by the [Global Scientific Guild](https://www.linkedin.com/company/global-scientific-guild/?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_search_srp_all%3B9rSwPkC2RrWLxQSvIJzQjQ%3D%3D), attended by renowned specialists in the field from: Australia, Canada, Switzerland, USA, Japan, Iran, India, China, Singapore, Brazil, Romania, Hungary, Germany, France, Israel, and New Zealand. The works of great scientific value, presented during the 3 days of the webinar, addressed various fields of integrative medicine, such as: acupuncture, anthroposophy, apitherapy, aromatherapy, phytotherapy, homeopathy, nutrition, TCM, etc.). Chairperson of the Webinar was world-renowned homeopathy specialist from Canada [Dr. Parvin Zarrin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/bio-quantum-academy84414829?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_profile_view_base_contact_details%3BUVsxtk4VSH%2Bdmq%2FmeeNdHA%3D%3D), and the Dean of [Bio Quantum Academy in Canada](https://bioquantum.ca/bio-quantum-academy/), seconded by [Dr. Steve Chiola](https://www.linkedin.com/in/steve-john-chiola-67118025?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAAUvp7UBp2hmZVrl-U1wVVymJS380lB0t0A&lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_search_srp_all%3BMVs6VhCBRxmR044ReMNfqQ%3D%3D) from Switzerland, expert in clinical aromatherapy, and Prof. Shozo Yaganida, from Osaka University in Japan, was Conference Honorary Co-Chairman. As an invited Co-Chairman, I had the opportunity to present a paper about the health benefits of spices and I was honored to collaborate with great specialists from all over the world dedicated to promoting the values of natural therapies.
